trans-unit.source: Build a web app with Python and Flask using DocumentDB | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Build a web app with Python and Flask using DocumentDB | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use DocumentDB to store and access data from an Python and Flask (MVC) web application hosted on Azure.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use DocumentDB to store and access data from an Python and Flask (MVC) web application hosted on Azure.

trans-unit.source: To highlight how customers can efficiently leverage Azure DocumentDB to store and query JSON documents, this document provides an end-to-end tutorial showing how to build a voting web application using Azure DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: To highlight how customers can efficiently leverage Azure DocumentDB to store and query JSON documents, this document provides an end-to-end tutorial showing how to build a voting web application using Azure DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use the DocumentDB service provided by Azure to store and access data from a Python web application hosted on Azure and presumes that you have some prior experience using Python and Azure websites.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use the DocumentDB service provided by Azure to store and access data from a Python web application hosted on Azure and presumes that you have some prior experience using Python and Azure websites.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial covers:
trans-unit.target: This tutorial covers:

trans-unit.source: Creating and provisioning a DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Creating and provisioning a DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Creating a Python MVC application.
trans-unit.target: Creating a Python MVC application.

trans-unit.source: Connecting to and using Azure DocumentDB from your web application.
trans-unit.target: Connecting to and using Azure DocumentDB from your web application.

trans-unit.source: Deploying the web application to Azure Websites.
trans-unit.target: Deploying the web application to Azure Websites.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple voting application that allows you to vote for a poll.
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple voting application that allows you to vote for a poll.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the todo list web application created by this tutorial</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the todo list web application created by this tutorial</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Before following the instructions in this article, you should ensure that you have the following installed:
trans-unit.target: Before following the instructions in this article, you should ensure that you have the following installed:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Visual Studio 2013</linkText><title></title> or higher, or Visual Studio Express, which is the free version.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Visual Studio 2013</linkText><title></title> or higher, or Visual Studio Express, which is the free version.

trans-unit.source: Python Tools for Visual Studio from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Python Tools for Visual Studio from <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013, version 2.4 or higher available from <linkText>here[1]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Azure SDK for Visual Studio 2013, version 2.4 or higher available from <linkText>here[1]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7 from <linkText>here[2]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Python 2.7 from <linkText>here[2]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Visual C++ Compiler for Python 2.7 from <linkText>here[3]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Visual C++ Compiler for Python 2.7 from <linkText>here[3]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Let's start by creating a DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Let's start by creating a DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: If you already have an account, you can skip to <linkText>Step 2: Create a new Python Flask web application</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you already have an account, you can skip to <linkText>Step 2: Create a new Python Flask web application</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: We will now walk through how to create a new Python Flask web application from the ground up.
trans-unit.target: We will now walk through how to create a new Python Flask web application from the ground up.

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio, click File -\> New Project -\> Python -\>, Flask Web Project, and then create a new project with the name tutorial.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio, click File -\> New Project -\> Python -\>, Flask Web Project, and then create a new project with the name tutorial.

trans-unit.source: For those new to Flask, it is a web framework that helps us build web applications in Python faster.
trans-unit.target: For those new to Flask, it is a web framework that helps us build web applications in Python faster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click here to access Flask tutorials</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click here to access Flask tutorials</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the New Project window in Visual Studio with Python highlighted on the left, Flask Web Project selected in the middle, and the name tutorial in the Name box</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the New Project window in Visual Studio with Python highlighted on the left, Flask Web Project selected in the middle, and the name tutorial in the Name box</linkText>

trans-unit.source: It will ask you whether you want to install external packages.
trans-unit.target: It will ask you whether you want to install external packages.

trans-unit.source: Click Install into a virtual environment.
trans-unit.target: Click Install into a virtual environment.

trans-unit.source: Be sure to use Python 2.7 as the base environment because PyDocumentDB does not currently support Python 3.x.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to use Python 2.7 as the base environment because PyDocumentDB does not currently support Python 3.x.

trans-unit.source: This will set up the required Python virtual environment for your project.
trans-unit.target: This will set up the required Python virtual environment for your project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the tutorial - Python Tools for Visual Studio window</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the tutorial - Python Tools for Visual Studio window</linkText>

trans-unit.source: After your project is set up, you need to add certain Flask packages that you will need for your project, including pydocumentdb, the Python package for DocumentDB.
trans-unit.target: After your project is set up, you need to add certain Flask packages that you will need for your project, including pydocumentdb, the Python package for DocumentDB.

trans-unit.source: Open the file named requirements.txt and replace the contents with the following:
trans-unit.target: Open the file named requirements.txt and replace the contents with the following:

trans-unit.source: Right-click env and click install from requirements.txt.
trans-unit.target: Right-click env and click install from requirements.txt.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot showing env (Python 2.7) selected with Install from requirements.txt highlighted in the list</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot showing env (Python 2.7) selected with Install from requirements.txt highlighted in the list</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In rare cases, you might see a failure in the output window.
trans-unit.target: In rare cases, you might see a failure in the output window.

trans-unit.source: If this happens, check if the error is related to cleanup.
trans-unit.target: If this happens, check if the error is related to cleanup.

trans-unit.source: Sometimes the cleanup fails, but the installation will still be successful (scroll up in the output window to verify this).
trans-unit.target: Sometimes the cleanup fails, but the installation will still be successful (scroll up in the output window to verify this).

trans-unit.source: <bookmark></bookmark> If this occurs, it's OK to continue.
trans-unit.target: <bookmark></bookmark> If this occurs, it's OK to continue.

trans-unit.source: Let's make sure that everything is installed correctly.
trans-unit.target: Let's make sure that everything is installed correctly.

trans-unit.source: Start the website by pressing F5 This launches the Flask development server and starts your web browser.
trans-unit.target: Start the website by pressing F5 This launches the Flask development server and starts your web browser.

trans-unit.source: You should see the following page.
trans-unit.target: You should see the following page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>The empty Flask project displayed in a browser</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>The empty Flask project displayed in a browser</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now let's create your voting application.
trans-unit.target: Now let's create your voting application.

trans-unit.source: Add a Python file by right-clicking the folder named tutorial in the Solution Explorer.
trans-unit.target: Add a Python file by right-clicking the folder named tutorial in the Solution Explorer.

trans-unit.source: Name the file forms.py.
trans-unit.target: Name the file forms.py.

trans-unit.source: Add the following import statements at the top in views.py.
trans-unit.target: Add the following import statements at the top in views.py.

trans-unit.source: These import DocumentDB's PythonSDK and the Flask packages.
trans-unit.target: These import DocumentDB's PythonSDK and the Flask packages.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to views.py.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to views.py.

trans-unit.source: This takes care of creating the database used by the form.
trans-unit.target: This takes care of creating the database used by the form.

trans-unit.source: Do not delete any of the existing code in views.py.
trans-unit.target: Do not delete any of the existing code in views.py.

trans-unit.source: Simply append this to the end.
trans-unit.target: Simply append this to the end.

trans-unit.source: The CreateCollection method takes an optional RequestOptions as the third parameter.
trans-unit.target: The CreateCollection method takes an optional RequestOptions as the third parameter.

trans-unit.source: This can be used to specify the Offer Type for the collection.
trans-unit.target: This can be used to specify the Offer Type for the collection.

trans-unit.source: If no offerType value is supplied, then the collection will be created using the default Offer Type.
trans-unit.target: If no offerType value is supplied, then the collection will be created using the default Offer Type.

trans-unit.source: For more information on DocumentDB Offer Types, see <linkText>Performance levels in DocumentDB</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on DocumentDB Offer Types, see <linkText>Performance levels in DocumentDB</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to views.py.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to views.py.

trans-unit.source: This takes care of setting up the form, reading the database, collection, and document.
trans-unit.target: This takes care of setting up the form, reading the database, collection, and document.

trans-unit.source: Do not delete any of the existing code in views.py.
trans-unit.target: Do not delete any of the existing code in views.py.

trans-unit.source: Simply append this to the end.
trans-unit.target: Simply append this to the end.

trans-unit.source: Under the templates folder, add the following html files: create.html, results.html, vote.html.
trans-unit.target: Under the templates folder, add the following html files: create.html, results.html, vote.html.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to create.html.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to create.html.

trans-unit.source: It takes care of displaying a message stating that we created a new database, collection, and document.
trans-unit.target: It takes care of displaying a message stating that we created a new database, collection, and document.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to results.html.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to results.html.

trans-unit.source: It takes care of displaying the results of the poll.
trans-unit.target: It takes care of displaying the results of the poll.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to vote.html.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to vote.html.

trans-unit.source: It takes care of displaying the poll and accepting the votes.
trans-unit.target: It takes care of displaying the poll and accepting the votes.

trans-unit.source: On registering the votes, the control is passed over to views.py where we will recognize the vote cast and append the document accordingly.
trans-unit.target: On registering the votes, the control is passed over to views.py where we will recognize the vote cast and append the document accordingly.

trans-unit.source: Replace the contents of index.html with the following.
trans-unit.target: Replace the contents of index.html with the following.

trans-unit.source: This serves as the landing page for your application.
trans-unit.target: This serves as the landing page for your application.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project name tutorial and add a file, config.py.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project name tutorial and add a file, config.py.

trans-unit.source: This config file is required by forms in Flask.
trans-unit.target: This config file is required by forms in Flask.

trans-unit.source: You can use it to provide a secret key as well.
trans-unit.target: You can use it to provide a secret key as well.

trans-unit.source: This key is not needed for this tutorial though.
trans-unit.target: This key is not needed for this tutorial though.

trans-unit.source: Add the following code to config.py.
trans-unit.target: Add the following code to config.py.

trans-unit.source: Alter the values of DOCUMENTDB\_HOST and DOCUMENTDB\_KEY.
trans-unit.target: Alter the values of DOCUMENTDB\_HOST and DOCUMENTDB\_KEY.

trans-unit.source: Similarly replace the contents of \_\_init\_\_.py with the following.
trans-unit.target: Similarly replace the contents of \_\_init\_\_.py with the following.

trans-unit.source: After following the above mentioned steps, this is how Solution Explorer should look.
trans-unit.target: After following the above mentioned steps, this is how Solution Explorer should look.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Visual Studio Solution Explorer window</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Visual Studio Solution Explorer window</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Press F5 or click the Run button in Visual Studio, and you should see the following on your screen.
trans-unit.target: Press F5 or click the Run button in Visual Studio, and you should see the following on your screen.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Python + DocumentDB Voting Application displayed in a web browser</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Python + DocumentDB Voting Application displayed in a web browser</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Create/Clear the Voting Database to generate the database.
trans-unit.target: Click Create/Clear the Voting Database to generate the database.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Create Page of the web application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Create Page of the web application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Then, click Vote and select your option.
trans-unit.target: Then, click Vote and select your option.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the web application with a voting question posed</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the web application with a voting question posed</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For every vote you cast, it increments the appropriate counter.
trans-unit.target: For every vote you cast, it increments the appropriate counter.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Results of the vote page shown</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Results of the vote page shown</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that you have the complete application working correctly against DocumentDB, we're going to deploy this to Azure Websites.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have the complete application working correctly against DocumentDB, we're going to deploy this to Azure Websites.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the project in Solution Explorer (make sure you're not still running it locally) and select Publish.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the project in Solution Explorer (make sure you're not still running it locally) and select Publish.

trans-unit.source: Then, select Microsoft Azure Websites.
trans-unit.target: Then, select Microsoft Azure Websites.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the tutorial selected in Solution Explorer, with the Publish option highlighted</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the tutorial selected in Solution Explorer, with the Publish option highlighted</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Configure your Azure website by providing your credentials and click Publish.
trans-unit.target: Configure your Azure website by providing your credentials and click Publish.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Screen shot of the Publish Web window</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Screen shot of the Publish Web window</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a few seconds, Visual Studio will finish publishing your web application and launch a browser where you can see your handy work running in Azure!
trans-unit.target: In a few seconds, Visual Studio will finish publishing your web application and launch a browser where you can see your handy work running in Azure!

trans-unit.source: Congratulations!
trans-unit.target: Congratulations!

trans-unit.source: You have just built your first Python application using Azure DocumentDB and published it to Azure Websites.
trans-unit.target: You have just built your first Python application using Azure DocumentDB and published it to Azure Websites.

trans-unit.source: We'd like to know if you found this tutorial helpful, so please use the voting buttons at the beginning or end of the topic to let us know how we did.
trans-unit.target: We'd like to know if you found this tutorial helpful, so please use the voting buttons at the beginning or end of the topic to let us know how we did.

trans-unit.source: This topic is actively being updated, so we want your feedback on improving it.
trans-unit.target: This topic is actively being updated, so we want your feedback on improving it.

trans-unit.source: If you'd like us to contact you, feel free to include your email address in the comment for follow-up.
trans-unit.target: If you'd like us to contact you, feel free to include your email address in the comment for follow-up.

trans-unit.source: To add additional functionality to your application, review the APIs available in the <linkText>DocumentDB Python SDK</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To add additional functionality to your application, review the APIs available in the <linkText>DocumentDB Python SDK</linkText><title></title>.
